title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in Tewksbury crash
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 56-year-old Dracut man was critically injured in a motorcycle crash in Tewksbury on Friday night.
The accident happened near Brook Street and Janet Avenue; the motorcyclist was found unconscious in nearby woods.
The injured man was airlifted to Lahey Hospital and Medical Center; police continue to investigate the crash.

title: Mike Vrabel had a blunt response to report about Titans owner’s alleged grudge
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel addressed a report suggesting Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk holds a grudge over his firing.
Vrabel dismissed comparisons between the 2025 Patriots and past teams, emphasizing the need to perform well in November.
Vrabel praised Patriots fans' loyalty and addressed the challenge of a quick turnaround for a Thursday game against the Jets.

title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics defeated the Magic 111-107 in Orlando, splitting the two-game series.
Luka Garza contributed 16 points and 8 rebounds, prompting a strong Celtics bench performance.
Anfernee Simons scored 25 points with a hot second-quarter surge, aiding the Celtics' win.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek has signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox for the 2026 season.
Varitek has served as the game-planning and run prevention coach on Alex Cora's staff since 2020.
Carlos Narvaez, a rookie catcher, batted .241 with 15 home runs and 50 RBI in the 2025 season.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookies Kyle Williams and TreVeyon Henderson combined for three touchdowns in a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Williams achieved his first NFL touchdown and reached a speed of 21.78 mph on a 71-yard catch in the first quarter.
Rookie TreVeyon Henderson set a speed record, scoring twice with runs over 50 yards, including a decisive 69-yard touchdown.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is the current NFL MVP frontrunner, according to oddsmakers including FanDuel and DraftKings.
In Sunday's game, Patriots' Maye threw for 270 yards, 2 touchdowns, and 1 interception against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
This season, Maye has completed 71.7% of his passes for 2,555 yards, 19 touchdowns, and 5 interceptions.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski will sign a one-day contract with the Patriots to officially retire as a New England player.
Gronkowski, regarded as one of the greatest tight ends, won three Super Bowls with the Patriots.
Gronkowski last played in the NFL with the Buccaneers after retiring and joining Tom Brady in Tampa Bay.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams led the Patriots with explosive plays, securing a 28-23 win over the Buccaneers.
Drake Maye had a 51% completion rate, extending his interception streak, but delivered key plays to secure the victory.
The offensive line improved significantly, allowing only one sack and creating running lanes, while tight ends had minimal impact.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriotsâ€™ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend win streak to seven games with a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams score three touchdowns for New England.
QB Drake Maye throws for 270 yards, two touchdowns, and one interception against Tampa Bay.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: MBTA Transit Police officer Jonathan Daveiga, 27, faces a drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into a pole.
Daveiga was arrested Oct. 19 at Leverett Circle and charged with operating under the influence, failing to stop or yield.
He pleaded not guilty, was released on personal recognizance, and was placed on 'modified duty' pending judicial proceedings.
